content.raw:
Pushed several changes to the keyboard teleop. I made the stride length default a bit more conservative so that when resetting the robot with an internal state that is off, it will be more stable. It should also turn in place and turn around a point better.

I still notice however, that when restarting the robot, issuing a simple step forward command can cause the robot to take large steps in different directions. I think the controller's internal state believes the robot to be in a different position than it currently is, so it tries to make large corrections. I've gotten around this by taking a couple of single steps with 0 length in place. Then taking a forward trajectory of 3 steps with stride length 0.1m. More often then not, this gets it to a usable situation.
